alert.note: Alert for Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 12:31PM EST until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Nancy Creek at West Wesley Road at Atlanta affecting Fulton County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Nancy Creek at West Wesley Road at Atlanta. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flood Stage is reached. Minor flooding of residential yards occurs along the creek upstream and downstream from the gage on West Wesley Road. This includes Nancy Creek Road and Ridge Valley Court. Portions of The Westminster Schools athletic fields upstream from the gage will begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 12.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:15 PM EST Tuesday was 12.1 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.8 feet on 02/06/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1245 AM EST.
